metadata.Title: CVE-2017-6512 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the rmtree and remove_tree functions in the File-Path module before 2.13 for Perl allows attackers to set the mode on arbitrary files via vectors involving directory-permission loosening logic.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6512` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcgi-fast-perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
libperl5.18 - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-base - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-debug - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
perl-modules - 5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: perl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.2-2ubuntu1.4').
